com.atiia.automation.sensors
Class NetFTSensor

java.lang.Object
  com.atiia.automation.sensors.NetFTSensor

public class NetFTSensor
extends java.lang.Object

Represents an ATI Industrial Automation Net F/T force and torque load cell.

Method Detail

readSingleFTRecord

public NetFTRDTPacket readSingleFTRecord()
                                  throws java.net.SocketException,
                                         java.io.IOException
Request a single RDT F/T record from the Net F/T sensor.

Returns:
the RDT Packet from the sensor.
Throws:
java.net.SocketException - If there is an error with the socket.
java.io.IOException - If there is an I/O error with the load cell.

startHighSpeedDataCollection

public java.net.DatagramSocket startHighSpeedDataCollection(int iCount)
                                                     throws java.net.SocketException,
                                                            java.io.IOException
Start interrupt-driven (high-speed) data collection from Net F/T sensor.

Parameters:
iCount - The number of samples to collect. A value of 0 means the Net F/T should keep outputting samples until it is sent a stop command. The stop command can be sent by calling stopDataCollection.
Returns:
A DatagramSocket that you should pass to subsequent calls to readHighSpeedData in order to read the samples sent back from the Net F/T.
Throws:
java.net.SocketException - A SocketException is thrown if there is a problem setting up the socket that is returned.
java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if there is a problem sending the start command to the Net F/T.

tare

public void tare()
          throws java.net.SocketException,
                 java.io.IOException
Tares the current load of the sensor.

Throws:
java.net.SocketException - A SocketException is thrown if there is trouble setting up the socket to send the tare command.
java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if there is trouble communicating with the sensor.

readHighSpeedData

public NetFTRDTPacket[] readHighSpeedData(java.net.DatagramSocket cNetFTSocket,
                                          int iCount)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Read high speed data from the Net F/T sensor. This method is not thread-safe, so take care that you do not perform other operations on the DatagramSocket while this function is executing, i.e. calling stopDataCollection while this function is executing could cause a "socket is closed" error.

Parameters:
cNetFTSocket - The socket returned from startHighSpeedDataCollection.
iCount - The number of samples to read from the Net F/T sensor. This can be less than the total number of samples that the Net F/T will output. I.e. you could call startHighSpeedDataCollection with a count of 1000, then call this function 10 times, each time reading 100 samples.
Returns:
An array of NetFTRDTPackets of length iCount, which represent the F/T records collected from the sensor.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An IOException will be thrown if there is an error reading data from the Net F/T.

stopDataCollection

public void stopDataCollection(java.net.DatagramSocket cNetFTSocket)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Stop the Net F/T from outputting any more RDT samples.

Parameters:
cNetFTSocket - The socket returned by startHighSpeedDataCollection. This socket will be closed by this function, so don't use it again!
Throws:
java.io.IOException - An IOException will be thrown if there is an error sending the stop command to the Net F/T.

getVersion

public static java.lang.String getVersion()
Get the version of the Net F/T interface.

Returns:
The version of the Net F/T interface.
